properties.Name: PartyDemographicCriteria

Columns.Name: PartyId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Party.

Columns.Name: DemographicCriteriaId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Demographic Criteria.

Columns.Name: PeriodStartDate
Columns.Description: The period start date for which the associated data is effective or 'as-of'.

Columns.Name: PeriodEndDate
Columns.Description: The period end date for which the associated data is effective or 'as-of'.

Columns.Name: PartyDemographicCriteriaNote
Columns.Description: A note, comment or additional information related to Party Demographic Criteria.

Demographics is the study of population composition based on socioeconomic variables including age, income, education, type of occupation, household size and so on.

Demographic information is used to analyze consumer behavior because the products purchased, where, when, by, whom tend to be strongly correlated to similar demographic characteristics of the purchasing party.

Demographic Segmentation is a marketing segmentation strategy based upon groups divided in demographic categories such as sex, age, occupation, religion, education level, race, nationality, income, family size etc.   

Demographic segmentation is the most widely-used and popular segmentation method because of the availability and depth of available data from a wide variety of sources.

Properties.Description:
The one or more demographic criteria that are assigned or linked to an Individual and by which they may be identified, analyzed or aggregated.   

These criteria can change over a period of time and are represented with 'period start date/period end date' qualifications, which represented the best case for knowing this information.    If the data is only randomly sampled or recorded then you could use a single 'date' to identify its recording or effective as-of date.

Demographics is the study of population composition based on socioeconomic variables including age, income, education, type of occupation, household size and so on.

Demographic information is used to analyze consumer behavior because the products purchased, where, when, by, whom tend to be strongly correlated to similar demographic characteristics of the purchasing party.

Demographic Segmentation is a marketing segmentation strategy based upon groups divided in demographic categories such as sex, age, occupation, religion, education level, race, nationality, income, family size etc.   

Demographic segmentation is the most widely-used and popular segmentation method because of the availability and depth of available data from a wide variety of sources.

Examples:

Demographic Criteria:   Ages 20-25
Demographic Criteria Type:  Age

Demographic Criteria:   Male, Female
Demographic Criteria Type:  Sex

Demographic Criteria:   2-4
Demographic Criteria Type:  Family Size

Demographic Criteria:   $15,000-$25,000
Demographic Criteria Type:  Income

Demographic Criteria:  Manager
Demographic Criteria Type:  Occupation

Demographic Criteria:   College graduate
Demographic Criteria Type:  Education  

Demographic Criteria:    Protestant
Demographic Criteria Type:  Religion

Demographic Criteria:  Asian
Demographic Criteria Type:  Race

Demographic Criteria:    German
Demographic Criteria Type:  Nationality

A Market Segment consists of one or more demographic criteria that are combined to create that market segment.

Ex: 

A Market Segment "Affluent Professional German Managers" could select the following Demographic Criteria for its composition:

Demographic Criteria:    German
Demographic Criteria Type:  Nationality

Demographic Criteria:    $75,000+
Demographic Criteria Type:  Income

Demographic Criteria:    Manager
Demographic Criteria Type:  Occupation
